comment.author: 55198937@N05
comment._content: Looks like a fun kindergarten class - toy animals, shuttlecock and a pet dog too!

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: The address over on the rh corner provides a few clues...jus googling around, I notice there's a 28 Collins Rd, Southsea, in Hampshire... homepage.ntlworld.com/stephen.pomeroy/local/schools.pdf (see p.24...warning largish document) suggests we might be looking at Miss Emily Capon's private school which was evidently located at this address in 1915...maybe this is a pic of Miss Emily and her charges! OK, how did this pic end up in Sam Hood's collection...that might be an interesting story! Scenes from Childhood! or maybe the cast of Pooh Bear (the silent movie). Beautiful!

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: GoogleMapsStreetView of 28 Collins Rd., Southsea, UK rear yard, showing brickwork similar to photo at top left. (Gotta love this armchair archaeology!) - goo.gl/maps/Wif9f

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] I'd say they're the same bricks...isn't that just something!

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/angeljim46] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/51979177@N02] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] It certainly is something! Amazing work all, it's such a random object from the collection, but interesting nonetheless! :-D
